Show all orders placed in the last 7 day:
SELECT c.name, o.order_id, o.order_date 
FROM customers c 
JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id 
WHERE o.order_date >= DATE('now', '-7 day')
Show all orders placed in the last year:
SELECT c.name, o.order_id, o.order_date 
FROM orders o 
JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id = c.customer_id 
WHERE o.order_date >= DATE('now', '-1 year')
Show revenue per category per month.C:\\:
SELECT STRFTIME('%Y-%m', o.order_date) AS month, p.category, SUM(oi.quantity * p.price) AS revenue
FROM orders o
JOIN order_items oi ON o.order_id = oi.order_id
JOIN products p ON oi.product_id = p.product_id
GROUP BY STRFTIME('%Y-%m', o.order_date), p.category
Top 5 customers by total spending.C:\\Us:
SELECT customer_id, total_spending 
FROM (
  SELECT customer_id, total_spending, 
  ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY total_spending DESC) as rank 
  FROM (
    SELECT customer_id, SUM(total_amount) as total_spending 
    FROM orders 
    GROUP BY customer_id
  )
) 
WHERE rank <= 5
Compare revenue between cities for the l:
SELECT city, SUM(total_amount) AS revenue 
FROM customers 
JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id 
WHERE orders.order_date > DATE('now', '-6 months') 
GROUP BY city 
ORDER BY revenue DESC
Who are our VIP customers?C:\\Users\\DEL:
SELECT name 
FROM (
  SELECT c.name, 
  ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY SUM(o.total_amount) DESC) as row_num
  FROM customers c
  JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id
  GROUP BY c.customer_id, c.name
)
WHERE row_num <= 10
Which products are not selling well?C:\\:
SELECT product_name 
FROM (
  SELECT p.product_name, 
  SUM(oi.quantity) as total_sales,
  ROW_NUMBER() OVER (ORDER BY SUM(oi.quantity)) as sales_rank
  FROM products p
  LEFT JOIN order_items oi ON p.product_id = oi.product_id
  GROUP BY p.product_name
)
WHERE sales_rank > (SELECT COUNT(*) FROM products) - 5
Show growth trend of revenue.C:\\Users\\:
SELECT 
  month, 
  revenue, 
  CASE 
    WHEN LAG(revenue) OVER (ORDER BY month) = 0 THEN NULL 
    ELSE (revenue - LAG(revenue) OVER (ORDER BY month)) / LAG(revenue) OVER (ORDER BY month) * 100 
  END AS growth_rate
FROM (
  SELECT 
    STRFTIME('%Y-%m', o.order_date) AS month, 
    SUM(o.total_amount) AS revenue
  FROM 
    orders o
  GROUP BY 
    STRFTIME('%Y-%m', o.order_date)
)
Show sales distribution across categorie:
SELECT category, SUM(total_sales) AS total_category_sales 
FROM ( 
  SELECT p.category, SUM(oi.quantity * p.price) AS total_sales 
  FROM products p 
  JOIN order_items oi ON p.product_id = oi.product_id 
  GROUP BY p.category 
) 
GROUP BY category 
ORDER BY total_category_sales DESC;
